com.solacesystems.common.util

Class ByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solacesystems.common.util.ByteBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ByteBuffer
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Reusable growable array of bytes. When an allocation is required the capacity is doubled.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      ByteBuffer(int initialSize)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteBuffer

        public ByteBuffer(int initialSize)

    • Method Detail

      • getBuffer

        public byte[] getBuffer()
        Gets the backing byte array. The capacity of the array may be much larger than the size of its contents. Use getBufferSize() for the size.
        Returns:
        The backing byte array.

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Returns the amount of data in the byte array.
        Returns:
        The amount of data in the byte array.

      • getBufferCapacity

        public int getBufferCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the backing byte array. This may grow dynamically as needed.
        Returns:
        The capacity of the backing byte array.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Sets the size of the byte array to 0. The capacity remains unchanged.

      • appendByte

        public void appendByte(byte aByte)
        Append a byte to the byte array. This may cause a reallocation if there is not enough space.
        Parameters:
        aByte - The byte to append to the array.

      • appendBytes

        public void appendBytes(byte[] bytes)
        Appends a byte array to the byte array. This may cause a reallocation if there is not enough space.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to append to the array.

      • appendBytes

        public void appendBytes(byte[] bytes,
               int offset,
               int length)
        Appends data from a byte array to the byte array. This may cause a reallocation if there is not enough space.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to append to the array.
        offset - Beginning offset to start copying from.
        length - Number of bytes to copy.

      • appendString

        public void appendString(String str)
        Appends data from a string to the byte array. This is a faster more efficient way of appending a String than appendBytes(str.getBytes());
        Parameters:
        str - The string to append.

      • realloc

        public void realloc(int size)
        Reallocates the byte array if more space is needed.
        Parameters:
        size - parameter

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
